metadata.Title: CVE-2009-5147 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
DL::dlopen in Ruby 1.8, 1.9.0, 1.9.2, 1.9.3, 2.0.0 before patchlevel 648, and 2.1 before 2.1.8 opens libraries with tainted names.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-5147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> The Debian triage mentions two points, first that the upstream fix has been dropped from upstream for unknown reasons; second, Fiddle in Ruby 2.2 has the same problem. MITRE hasn't (yet?) assigned a CVE for 7269e3de3cee3bbb6ab77fc708f3a10cab00b65e but that may be for their own reasons. mdeslaur> DL was removed in 2.2 This is the same issue as CVE-2015-7551, except only for 1.9.1

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3').
